definition: beautiful/very satisfactory/good/to beautify/to be pleased with oneself
the Americas/abbr. for 美洲[Mei3 zhou1]/USA/abbr. for 美國|美国[Mei3 guo2]

sentences.english: She has done a beautiful thing to me.
sentences.chinese: 她在我身上做的是一件美事。

sentences.english: I slept, and dreamt that life was Beauty, I woke, and found that life was Duty.
sentences.chinese: 睡時夢覺生活是美事，醒來發現生活是責任。

sentences.english: Taking dangerous weeks for beauty, can not boast, its thick DE yi.
sentences.chinese: 扶危周急固爲美事，能不自誇，則其厚德矣。

sentences.english: Have not I written to thee excellent things in counsels and knowledge
sentences.chinese: 謀略和知識的美事，我豈沒有寫給你嗎。

sentences.english: She has got married to Mr. Ann, which is graceful.
sentences.chinese: 她嫁給了安先生，這是一件美事。

sentences.english: This is a child do not know how much hope and so come back to it a cause for rejoicing.
sentences.chinese: 這是小時候不知盼了多少回纔等來的一件美事。

sentences.english: for she hath wrought a good work upon me.
sentences.chinese: 他在我身上作的，是一件美事。

sentences.english: Where can I seek this nice thing?

definition: good action, deed, thing or work (also sarcastic, "a fine thing indeed")/charity/happy occasion/Daoist or Buddhist ceremony for the souls of the dead
refined activities of the intellectuals (regarding literature, paintings etc)
to satisfy rival demands (idiom)/to get the best of both worlds/to have it both ways/to have one's cake and eat it too
a matter for regret/sth that is a (great) pity
lit. seek but fail to get (idiom); fig. exactly what one’s been looking for
fine time, beautiful scenery (idiom); everything lovely
lit. the happy fate of the man from Qi (who had a wife and a concubine) (idiom)/fig. (ironically) the joy of having several partners/the life of a pasha
